item.title: Innovation at Universities
item.description: Who should have the rights to innovations created at a university: professors or the university? A natural answer would be the professors; they came up with the idea in the first place. But thatâ€™s not how it works in the US. In the US, professors have rights to roughly a third of the income from patents and ventures started at universities. This arrangement is motivated by the fact that universities are a crucial partner in innovation.
